%\setlength{\fboxsep}{-1.5mm}  % adjust cod_vpad/pro_vpad background box

%% Background for code blocks (parameter is color name)

%% pro/cod_vpad: gives some vertical padding before and after the text
%% (but has more simplistic code than _cod/pro_tight+cod/pro).
%% pro/cod_vpad can be used to enclose Verbatim or lst begin/end for code.
%% pro/cod calls _pro/cod_tight and has very little vertical padding,
%% used to enclose Verbatim and other begin/end for code.
%% (pro/cod is what the ptex2tex program could produce with the
%% Blue/BlueBar definitions in .ptex2tex.cfg.)

\newenvironment{cod_vpad}[1]{
   \def\FrameCommand{\colorbox{#1}}
   \MakeFramed{\FrameRestore}}
   {\endMakeFramed}

\newenvironment{_cod_tight}[1]{
   \def\FrameCommand{\colorbox{#1}}
   \FrameRule0.6pt\MakeFramed {\FrameRestore}\vskip3mm}
   {\vskip0mm\endMakeFramed}

\newenvironment{cod}[1]{
\bgroup\rmfamily
\fboxsep=0mm\relax
\begin{_cod_tight}{#1}
\list{}{\parsep=-2mm\parskip=0mm\topsep=0pt\leftmargin=2mm
\rightmargin=2\leftmargin\leftmargin=4pt\relax}
\item\relax}
{\endlist\end{_cod_tight}\egroup}

%% Background for complete program blocks (parameter 1 is color name
%% for background, parameter 2 is color for left bar)
\newenvironment{pro_vpad}[2]{
   \def\FrameCommand{\color{#2}\vrule width 1mm\normalcolor\colorbox{#1}}
   \MakeFramed{\FrameRestore}}
   {\endMakeFramed}

\newenvironment{_pro_tight}[2]{
   \def\FrameCommand{\color{#2}\vrule width 1mm\normalcolor\colorbox{#1}}
   \FrameRule0.6pt\MakeFramed {\advance\hsize-2mm\FrameRestore}\vskip3mm}
   {\vskip0mm\endMakeFramed}

\newenvironment{pro}[2]{
\bgroup\rmfamily
\fboxsep=0mm\relax
\begin{_pro_tight}{#1}{#2}
\list{}{\parsep=-2mm\parskip=0mm\topsep=0pt\leftmargin=2mm
\rightmargin=2\leftmargin\leftmargin=4pt\relax}
\item\relax}
{\endlist\end{_pro_tight}\egroup}

% (from BYUTextbook)
\makeatletter

\hbox{}
\thispagestyle{empty}
\newpage
\if@twocolumn\hbox{}\newpage\fi\fi\fi}
\makeatother

\makeatother

\chapter{Automatic execution of code blocks}

Compile this document with

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
doconce format execute.do.txt --execute
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent

Hidden execution cells can be used to perform operations that need to be done
before the following cells are executed:









This is a cell that should execute automatically:

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{python}
b = 2
c = a + b
print("The result is {}".format(c))
c
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
The result is 3

\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent
\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
3
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent


\section{Plotting}

This is a cell that should plot and output:

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{python}
from pylab import *
x = linspace(0, 10, 100)
plot(x, x*x)
show()
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-8e1455afee6c> in <module>()
----> 1 from pylab import *
      2 x = linspace(0, 10, 100)
      3 plot(x, x*x)
      4 show()

ImportError: No module named 'pylab'
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent


To improve quality when exporting to {\LaTeX}, the following code has automatically
been run to enable PDF export in notebooks.

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
from IPython.display import set_matplotlib_formats
set_matplotlib_formats('png', 'pdf')
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent

\section{Ignore output}

Predefined output can be omitted by passing \Verb!--ignore_output! to DocOnce.
This will remove all environments ending with \texttt{out}.

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{python}
a = 2
print(a)
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
2

\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent


\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
2
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent

\section{Not executed}

This is a code block that should not be executed:

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
while True:
    i = 2
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent

This is some \emph{formatted} stuff, which is \textbf{underlined} and stuff and maybe even
contains $a + 2b$.

\section{Code with errors}

If code contains errors, it will still be run and the exception shown as part
of the output:

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{python}
for a in range(10)
    print(a)
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
  File "<ipython-input-6-9959af584c9a>", line 1
    for a in range(10)
                      ^
SyntaxError: invalid syntax

\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent


\section{Opening files}

The working directory is the same as the .do.txt file.
You may want to use \texttt{os.chdir} to change the directory.

\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{python}
with open("../LICENSE") as f:
    print(f.read())
\end{minted}
\end{cod}
\noindent\begin{cod}{cbg_blue1}\begin{minted}[fontsize=\fontsize{9pt}{9pt},linenos=false,mathescape,baselinestretch=1.0,fontfamily=tt,xleftmargin=2mm]{text}
